line_1: But I believe when it comes the tryal,
line_2: Ask but for ten and you'll have the denial.

line_1: And was resolv'd upon a Tryal,
line_2: HOWE'ER she gave no flat Denial,

line_1: But leaves to Standers-by the Tryal,
line_2: Of what is mark'd upon her Dial.

line_1: Could Pedro, think You, make no Tryal
line_2: Of a Sonata on his Viol,

line_1: 'Now if you'll take her upon trial,

line_2: But soon he saw the brisk awakening viol,

line_1: That, by St Kit, had wrought much sorer Tryal:
line_2: Full merveillous, I wote, were swilk Denyal.
"What is to recompence the harsh denyal,

line_1: These crimes successive, on your trial,
line_2: Have met with proofs beyond denial;

line_1: WHAT mortal Man could stand the Tryal!
line_2: He must consent, there's no denial,
